txt.en: Talk to Góda in the Mead Hall of Eaworth
Ingbert has instructed you to lend your aid to his mother, Lady Góda, as she plans for the defence of Eaworth.

'Ah, [placeholder], you must forgive my grandson... he is headstrong. You have made the wise decision, and he will see that when his head cools.

'For now, we need to know the strength of the Enemy abroad, if we are to truly prepare our defences. Make a patrol of the Vale and return to me with your findings. Here, let me mark the points upon your map....

'There... now, go swiftly and do not return until you have determined the strength of the Orcs!'
Góda has instructed you to make a patrol of the Entwash Vale to determine the strength of the Enemy.\n\nYou should patrol the first point.

Góda seems distressed.

'You have returned! And none too soon, I am afraid. You have performed the task given you, but it is for naught, I fear.

'You should speak with Ingbert.'
Góda has instructed you to make a patrol of the Entwash Vale to determine the strength of the Enemy.\n\nYou should patrol the second point.
Góda has instructed you to make a patrol of the Entwash Vale to determine the strength of the Enemy.\n\nYou should patrol the third point.
Góda has instructed you to make a patrol of the Entwash Vale to determine the strength of the Enemy.\n\nYou should patrol the fourth point.
Góda has instructed you to make a patrol of the Entwash Vale to determine the strength of the Enemy.\n\nYou should patrol the final point.
Lady Góda is in the Mead Hall of Eaworth, in the Entwash Vale.\n\nYou should return to Lady Góda with news of your success.
